newsitem.title: BULGARIA: Bulgaria seeks Japanese aid in transport projects.
newsitem.headline: Bulgaria seeks Japanese aid in transport projects.

text.p: Bulgaria, struggling to modernise its transport infrastructure, has invited Japan to invest in its major infrastructure projects worth $1.7 billion, Transport Minister Stamen Stamenov said on Friday.
At a joint news conference with his visiting Japanese counterpart, Yoshiyuki Kamei, Stamenov said he had handed him the Bulgarian priority projects.

"They are the development and reconstruction of the Sofia airport, worth $350 million, the modernisation of the Black Sea port of Bourgas, worth $270 million and its airport, worth $70 million," Stamenov said.
He added that Bulgaria had also asked Japan for its technical and financial aid for the financial stabilisation of the country's Balkan Airlines, the national carrier.
Kamei said the Japanese side would send its experts to study the projects first and added that the Bourgas port could become a link between Europe and central Asia.

"The Japanese government intends to support Bulgaria in carrying out its reform in its transition to market economy," Kamei told reporters through an interpreter, winding up his three-day visit to Bulgaria.
Kamei, who visited Bourgas and Black Sea resorts, met Prime Minister Zhan Videnov.
